summary: The Stop Russian Market Manipulation Act aims to prohibit the importation of specific minerals (platinum, nickel, and copper) from the Russian Federation, including minerals obtained in ways designed to circumvent the ban. The prohibition goes into effect 90 days after enactment and can be lifted one year after the President certifies to Congress that Russia has ended hostilities against Ukraine. The act includes a probationary period and specifies a definition of a Russian entity. The President cannot waive the prohibition.
